title: NUDT15 Polymorphism Confer Increased Susceptibility to Thiopurine-Induced Leukopenia in Patients With Autoimmune Hepatitis and Related Cirrhosis
summary: This study investigates the role of NUDT15 R139C polymorphism and TPMT genotype in increasing susceptibility to thiopurine-induced leukopenia among 149 Chinese patients diagnosed with autoimmune hepatitis and related cirrhosis. The findings demonstrate a significant association between the NUDT15 T risk allele and the development of leukopenia following azathioprine treatment, with a notable odds ratio of 20.41. The study indicates that patients with the rs116855232 CC and CT genotypes required different azathioprine dosages to achieve safety and efficacy, highlighting the potential for personalized medication adjustments based on NUDT15 genotyping. Conversely, no significant association was noted for TPMT genotypes. The findings support routine genotyping of NUDT15 and TPMT for optimizing thiopurine therapy in this patient population.

study_parameters.Characteristics: Patients with autoimmune hepatitis treated with azathioprine
Patients with rs116855232 CC and CT genotypes
Leukopenia observed in patients with NUDT15 CT genotype

var_drug_ann.Notes: The T risk allele in NUDT15 is significantly associated with thiopurine-induced leukopenia in Chinese patients (P < 0.00001, odds ratio = 20.41).
var_drug_ann.Sentence: The T allele is associated with increased risk of leukopenia in azathioprine context in Chinese patients with autoimmune hepatitis.
Citations: the T risk allele in NUDT15 is significantly associated with thiopurine-induced leukopenia in Chinese patients (P < 0.00001, odds ratio = 20.41)
the rs116855232 variant allele resulted in a 7.86-fold (P < 0.00001, 95% confidence interval (CI): 6.13-10.08) increased risk of developing leukopenia
When evaluated by rs116855232 genotype, leukopenia was significantly associated with the T allele [P < 0.00001, odds ratio = 20.41; 95% CI (7.84, 53.13)]

var_pheno_ann.Notes: The T risk allele was significantly associated with thiopurine-induced leukopenia (P < 0.00001, odds ratio = 20.41; 95% CI (7.84, 53.13)). Lower maintenance dosage was required for patients with CT genotype compared to wild-type CC.
var_pheno_ann.Sentence: rs116855232 is associated with increased risk of leukopenia when treated with azathioprine in Chinese patients with autoimmune hepatitis and related cirrhosis.
Citations: The rs116855232 variant allele resulted in a 7.86-fold (*P* < 0.00001, 95% confidence interval (CI): 6.13-10.08) increased risk of developing leukopenia...
When evaluated by rs116855232 genotype, leukopenia was significantly associated with the T allele [*P* < 0.00001, odds ratio = 20.41; 95% CI (7.84, 53.13)]...
The median maintenance dosages for patients with the rs116855232 CC and CT genotypes were 1.23 (0.95, 1.53) mg ⋅ kg−1 ⋅ d−1 and 0.96 (0.83, 1.19) mg ⋅ kg−1 ⋅ d−1, respectively (*P* = 0.028)...

var_fa_ann.Notes: 12 out of 149 patients developed leukopenia, significant association with T risk allele (P < 0.00001) with odds ratio 20.41; sensitivity 91.67%, specificity 89.05%.
var_fa_ann.Sentence: NUDT15 rs116855232 (R139C) is associated with increased risk of leukopenia when treated with azathioprine as compared to wild-type.
Citations: Twelve patients developed leukopenia, and this adverse drug reaction was significantly associated with the T risk allele in NUDT15 [P < 0.00001, odds ratio = 20.41; 95% confidence interval (CI) (7.84, 53.13)], with the sensitivity and specificity of 91.67 and 89.05%, respectively.
We found that a NUDT15 polymorphism (rs116855232) was significantly associated with AZA-induced leukopenia in Chinese patients with AIH and related cirrhosis.
The NUDT15 variant allele had a high predictability for leukopenia (42.3%, 11/26).
